intro: Saussurea riederi subsp. riederi, commonly known as the Tibetan safflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, pale flowers that bloom in the summer months. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
